Topic.Title: Better than Yelp, Angi, Zillow, Open Table or MeetMe - All Yahoo should not buy

Message.Msg: The market-cap of Zillow is a joke, if you compare: Business Outlook of Zillow with 1,750 million market cap: Zillow says it expects first-quarter sales of $36 million to $37 million, better than the $35.4 million analysts had been expecting, according to Thomson Reuters. That are about 160 million in 2013. Fiscal 2013 Financial Guidance of Local Corp with 36 million market cap: Revenue - The company expects 2013 revenue of between $93 million and $95 million, which at the mid-point, is an increase of 12 percent, over the fourth quarter 2012 exit run rate. Adjusted Net Income – Adjusted Net Income for 2013 is expected to be at least $5 million, which would result in approximately $1 million in debt-free cash flow. The company defines debt-free cash flow as cash provided by operating activities, less capital expenditures. Zillow has with 160 million revenues in 2013 against the 94 million of Local Corp only the 1.7-fold revenues, but with 1,790 million market-cap against the idiotic low 36 million of Local Corp the 50-fold market-cap.

Topic.Title: Oppenheimer Upgrade

Message.Msg: Oppenheimer upgraded Yahoo! citing an increased valuation for the company's Alibaba stake and higher Search revenue expectations from toolbar/application providers. Opco expects Alibaba will complete its IPO within the next 12 months at a $77B valuation, making Yahoo!'s 24% stake worth $10.18 per share. The firm raised its pric etarget for Yahoo! shares to $27 from $22.

Message.Title: Oppenheimer Upgrades Yahoo to Outperform with $27 PT
Message.Msg: Yahoo, already up substantially since Marissa Mayer took over as CEO, is adding on another 1.61% ahead of the open after getting upgraded to Outperform from Perform at Oppenheimer. Alibaba, still 24% owned by Yahoo, is expected to complete a $77 billion Initial Public Offering in the next 12 months. Strong search revenues are another reason for optimism, in Oppenheimer’s assessment, and its price objective increases to $27 from $22.

Topic.Title: Yahoo Japan to deepen ties with Softbank, Nikkei reports

Message.Msg: Yahoo Japan Corp. (4689) intends to strengthen its cooperation with Softbank Corp. (9984.TO) by jointly developing smartphones and related services, its incoming Chief Executive Officer told The Nikkei on Tuesday. Yahoo Japan, a joint venture between Softbank and Yahoo! Inc., holds a roughly 70% share of Japan's Web portal market. It is "looking to become No. 1 in smartphones as well," said Senior Vice President Manabu Miyasaka, who is slated to become CEO on April 1. The collaborations with Softbank will leverage the parent's strength in telecommunications and Yahoo Japan's Internet savvy, according to Miyasaka. Their joint efforts might include developing smartphones with built-in functions for using Yahoo-brand Internet services. The ability to launch applications rapidly is becoming increasingly crucial for succeeding in the competitive smartphone market. To speed application development, Yahoo Japan is considering beefing up its 2,000-strong development team. U.S. parent Yahoo!, which holds a 34.8% stake in Yahoo Japan, has been considering selling shareholdings in the unit for roughly two years. Yahoo Japan will continue negotiating with the U.S. parent on the matter, Miyasaka said.

Message.Msg: No..!! I'm saying 1975 was the last year America had a trade surplus.... Which means when Ben tells the US Treasury to stop printing $85 billion US dollars a month.... those young people will see inflation go higher than one of those E-clouds they have all their lives sitting upon.... America didn't have 46 million on food stamps and 20 million unemployed in 1975. But for thirty-seven years dollars have been taken from the "haves" in America and put into the hands of the "have-nots" of foreign lands. Retail makes NOTHING.....it only moves a countries currency. Wal*Mart has their Global Procurement Office in China.... Ms Mayer was sitting on Wal*Mart's Board before being appointed CEO of that exclamation mark. This ain't about a business model....it's about FREEDOM, LIBERTY AND HOPE. Because when all the US dollars are being held by foreigners....you young Americans can kiss your butt goodbye because not even one of those foreign gadgets you thumb the sh!! out of is gonna save it. good day..!!

Message.Title: Yahoo is building new data center in Lockport, NY, creating 115 jobs
Message.Msg: Yahoo announced today that it intends to expand in New York, adding centers for both data and customer care in Lockport, a city in Niagara County that sports a mere 20,000 souls. The company cited capacity as the reason for the data center expansion, stating that it would ensure that “Yahoo users have fast product experiences.” Yahoo as a company is in transformation, reforming its portal-based business towards a more mobile-focused business footprint. With the still-recent hiring of Marissa Mayer as its CEO, the firm has cut a new jib in terms of its product focus From TNW

Message.Title: Every stitch in place
Message.Msg: We'd all like to see Yahoo really succeed. One thing that needs to be done is reexamine you email security system. I forget something or other as a password, then had to go through repeated typing of semi-camaflodged nonsens words followed by successive failures. You are here to serve YOUR CUSTOMERS. Too many kids playing at being software designers. Playing at being managers. You need to provide an email experience that is significantly superior to GOOGLE's. Do it. Do to make us jump through silly and unnecessyr childish hoops. We WILL go elsewhere.

Topic.Title: What are the three main factors that will keep yahoos stock strong?

Message.Msg: Factor two, For Yahoo or any Company that is adjusting through any time. Keeping Cramer’s mouth taped shut will help! Cramer posts allow for fear and terror for snap sales or snap buys. Cramer is doing his best to stimulate most Companies from past not future performance. Cramer cannot say The Street share value on December 2013 “will“ be $ ? Cramer posts his opium and Companies can lose investors wrongly. Keeping Cramer’s mouth taped shut will help!

Topic.Title: Oppenheimer Upgrades Yahoo to Outperform with $27 PT

Message.Msg: This is a huge upgrade. Good reason why YHOO is up over 3% today with a down market. Like others mentioned here an upgrade by GS expect YHOO to trade and close at least a dollar higher.

Message.Title: Volume impressive
Message.Msg: Need a few more 25 million volume days for this to break out of the short term trading range. There are only six trading days left in March, and YHOO will have to fill it share repurchase quota. Earlier this month, looked at some targets and concluded that the Fibonacci extension could take it to around $26.50, with little resistance in the $23 to $26 range.
